bioghist.p: Cameron Parker Hall (1898-1987) was educated at Union Theological Seminary and Edinburgh University. He was student pastor at the University of Wisconsin, after which he was named director of the Department of Church and Society of the United Presbyterian Church, USA. This position led to his selection as head of the Department of Church and Economic Life in the Federal Council of Churches. He remained in this post when the Federal Council was succeeded by the National Council of Churches in 1950, continuing until his retirement in 1968. He was the editor of the 11 volume series on Ethics and Economic Life published in the 1950s. Cameron P. Hall called a conference and edited a small volume published by the National Council of Churches in 1963 titled On-the-Job Ethics.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes sermons as well as drafts of speeches and articles, written in both his official capacity and out of personal interest, whose topics include industrial labor relations, social and economic change, religion and work, materialism, the People's Peace Movement, the arms race, and McCarthyism. There is a a small quantity of material related to the Division of Church and Economic Life of the National Council of Churches of Christ, including minutes, memoranda, reports, pamphlets and a small number of newspaper clippings. There are also photographs, an invitation to the inauguration of Lyndon Johnson and drafts and copies of wills, 1975. The collection also includes drafts of an autobiographical sketch by Hall from 1980.
